CaseType.Description: Account Verification helps businesses to mitigate risk by verifying both the consumer’s identity and that the active credit card or bank account is associated with that consumer.
CaseType.Name: VerifyAccount

Source.Value: Equifax provides Verification APIs that help businesses confirm an individual’s identity and validate their financial accounts in real time. These APIs use Equifax’s extensive data sources to authenticate personal information (e.g., SSN, name, DOB, address) and verify bank account ownership, status, and balance. They're widely used for KYC (Know Your Customer), fraud prevention, and onboarding workflows in financial services and fintech.  This Case type demostrates the Account Verification API of Equifax. The Account Verification API is used for customers to verify details about payments using creditcards and bank accounts (individual consumer and commercial bank accounts). The customer can pass the PII data attribute list and credit card or bank account information for verification. The response will be a Boolean Y or N response to each category of Identity data passed in Request.
